Name: AX\_SemanticPathElement\_Minimality
Intent: Define Semantic Path Elements as minimal χ-step evolution arrows.
Constraints: 1. Edge form: Each Semantic Path Element e has (state\_in\_ref(e), state\_out\_ref(e), χ\_step\_ref(e)).
2. Minimal χ: χ\_step\_ref(e) \= χ\_step (the atomic χ increment).
3. No splitting: If e corresponds to a path with total Δχ \= χ\_step, then e cannot be decomposed into nontrivial concatenations of shorter path elements.
4. Path foundation: Any finite χ-evolution history can be represented as a finite ordered sequence of Semantic Path Elements.
5. Sealed: The definition of a Semantic Path Element may only be extended by adding metadata; its core triple is fixed.
